abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Matruh Resource Management
            Project's (MRMP II) Environmental Management Plan (EMP)
            is to identify the environmental mitigation measures,
            screening process, capacity building and monitoring
            activities to be undertaken, as well as the institutional
            arrangements to be set up to ensure that any potential
            adverse environmental impacts are either eliminated or
            minimized. The overall environmental impacts of the project
            are expected to be positive. The inclusion of the Global
            Environmental Facility component will ensure that
            environmental considerations are mainstreamed in the
            project. The environmental assessment identifies potential
            environmental impacts on drinking water quality. To reduce
            the impact of water contamination by sewage or animal
            wastes, cisterns will be dredged every three years to
            restore the dead storage capacity taken up by sedimentation.
            Animals will be kept away from the cisterns used for
            drinking water. Water treatment mitigation measures involve
            the sterilization of water. To reduce the potential impacts
            related to the range rehabilitation activities, the location
            will be planned and a connectivity between the areas for
            habitat will be maintained. Construction of cisterns must
            incorporate a silt trap, sediment basin and sieve on the
            inlet side of the cistern to reduce potential impacts from
            the small-scale infrastructure subprojects and rural roads.
